io.openhc.ohc.basestation.device

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.openhc.ohc.basestation.device.Field
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents data in the memory of smart devices. All variables on a smart device that can be changed by the user are represented as fields. A field is a memory segment storing data of a specific type.
    Author:
    Tobias Schramm
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field()
        Only used for serialization

      • Field

        public Field(OHC ohc,
             java.lang.String devie_id,
             int field_id,
             Field.Type type,
             java.lang.String name,
             double min_value,
             double max_value,
             boolean writable)
        The default constructor. Does not take an initial value for the field but constructs a default value from the given minimum value
        Parameters:
        ohc - The ohc instance containing the device this field is associated with
        devie_id - The internal id of the associated device
        field_id - The numeric id of this field
        type - The type of data stored in this field
        name - The human readable name of this field
        min_value - The minimum value this field can have
        max_value - The maximum value this field can have
        writable - Is this field writable

      • Field

        public Field(OHC ohc,
             java.lang.String devie_id,
             int field_id,
             Field.Type type,
             java.lang.String name,
             double min_value,
             double max_value,
             boolean writable,
             java.lang.Object value)
        Almost the same as the default constructor but does take an extra argument for the field value.
        Parameters:
        ohc - The ohc instance containing the device this field is associated with
        devie_id - The internal id of the associated device
        field_id - The numeric id of this field
        type - The type of data stored in this field
        name - The human readable name of this field
        min_value - The minimum value this field can have
        max_value - The maximum value this field can have
        writable - Is this field writable
        value - Initial value of this field

    • Method Detail

      • set_value

        public void set_value(java.lang.Object value,
                      boolean from_user)
               throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Sets and commits a new value for this field. Throws a ClassCastException if the type of value and the field type don't match
        Parameters:
        value - The new value
        from_user - Has this change in field value been initiated by the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • set_accessible

        public void set_accessible(boolean accessible)
        Set if this field is accessible. Inaccessible fields are marked as invalid and thus not displayed to the user
        Parameters:
        accessible - Accessibility of the field

      • set_ohc_instance

        public void set_ohc_instance(OHC ohc)
        Sets the ohc instance that contains the basestation with a reference to this field. Primarily used for reassigning a ohc instance after deserialization of this class
        Parameters:
        ohc - OHC instance
